A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Terrible. A disaster. A tragedy of cinematic historical proportion. I stood in line for the first showing of Star Wars - Episode IV . I am a major fan\, but not a fanatic. My guess is that this franchise is more important to more people than any other. I was optimistic about the move to Disney. I liked Episode VII; in my view\, it maintained the tradition and gave me New Hope. Now\, that is gone. This train wreck failed in the most important way: the story. I won't be in line for the next one\, but will be interested to hear whether Disney approved a total sell out and made the franchise a vehicle for children and pre-teens\, or whether they give it back to JJ\, and tried to put it back on track as much as possible as if Episode Viii never happened. PS I know the Empire Strikes Back. I loved the Empire Strikes Back. This disaster cannot seriously be compared to that film.
